intro: Halimocnemis pedunculata, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with fleshy, ribbed stems and small, linear leaves adapted to conserve water. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, and they bloom in spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant is well-suited to sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
